type.title: Type of data in the exposure
type.description: Exposure type is used by DMS to direct Science Data Processing code (SDP) and calibration, as well as provide metadata for archive searches. For a given template the EXP_TYPE keyword value is obtained for each exposure from the EXPOSURE_TYPE exposure-level parameter in the Observatory Status File (OSF). In a few cases, additional information is required to set the value for the EXP_TYPE keyword.

readpatt.title: Readout pattern
readpatt.description: The readout pattern (READPATT) name designates a pre-defined combination of NFRAMES, GROUPGAP, and NRESETS that was used for the exposure. Each unique combination of these parameters determines not only the timing of detector readouts and resets during an exposure, but also the cadence of the resulting data frames that are downlinked from the telescope.

nints.title: Number of integrations in exposure
nints.description: Number of integrations within the exposure. An exposure consists of one or more integrations, and an integration contains one or more groups. Each integration within an exposure is required to have the same number of groups. For NINTS of one , the count rate image produced in the level 2a data product is single two-dimensional data array contained in FITS science image extension. For NINTS greater than one, a second level 2a product will be generated with a separate count rate image for each integration within the exposure.

segment_total.title: total number segments
segment_total.description: The total number of segments in a single exposure of a Time Series Observation.
segment_total.mode: NRC_TSIMAGE (always), NRC_TSGRISM (always), MIR_IMAGE (allowed, default=no), MIR_MRS (allowed, default=no), MIR_LRS-SLITLESS (allowed, default=no), NRS_BRIGHTOBJ (always), NIS_SOSS (allowed, default=yes)

segment_number.title: sequential segment number
segment_number.description: The sequential segment number in a single exposure of a Time Series Observation.
segment_number.mode: NRC_TSIMAGE (always), NRC_TSGRISM (always), MIR_IMAGE (allowed, default=no), MIR_MRS (allowed, default=no), MIR_LRS-SLITLESS (allowed, default=no), NRS_BRIGHTOBJ (always), NIS_SOSS (allowed, default=yes)

integration_start.title: Starting integration number in this segment
integration_start.description: For segmented exposure products, this keyword gives the number of the first integration contained within the segment.

integration_end.title: Ending integration number in this segment
integration_end.description: For segmented exposure products, this keyword gives the number of the last integration contained within the segment.

ngroups.title: Number of groups in integration
ngroups.description: Number of groups in integration. Each integration within an exposure is required to have the same number of groups. The total number of groups in an exposure is determined by NGROUPS * NINTS. One exception to this is for instrument MIRI with readout pattern FASTGRPAVG, where the instrument flight settings are inconsistent with other modes. In this case NGROUPS per integration is calculated as NGROUPS = NGROUPS / NFRAMES, where NFRAMES=FRMDIVSR.

nframes.title: Number of frames per group
nframes.description: Number of frames in a group
nframes.calculation: Datamode table lookup.  One exception is for instrument MIRI and readout pattern FASTGRPAVG where NFRAMES=FRMDIVSR because the instrument flight settings are inconsistent with other modes.
nframes.source: Science and Operations Center Project Reference Database (PRD)

groupgap.title: Number of frames dropped between groups
groupgap.description: Number of frames skipped between groups

nsamples.title: Number of A/D samples per pixel
nsamples.description: Number of A/D samples per read of pixel. One in every mode but MIRI SLOW which has a value of ten
nsamples.source: Science and Operations Center Project Reference Database (PRD)

sample_time.title: [us] Time between samples
sample_time.description: Delta time between samples in units of microsec.

frame_time.title: [s] Time between frames
frame_time.description: Time between start of successive frames in units of seconds.

group_time.title: [s] Time between groups
group_time.description: Time between start of successive groups in units of seconds.
group_time.misc: Engineering values used for MIRI time calc.  See mirifits.py to see list of engineering parameters.

integration_time.title: [s] Effective integration time
integration_time.description: Effective integration Time in units of seconds.
integration_time.calculation: (NGROUPS-1)*TGROUP+(TGROUP0) where TGROUP and TGROUP0 are calculated

nresets_at_start.title: Number of resets at start of exposure
nresets_at_start.description: Number of resets at start of exposure
nresets_at_start.source: Science and Operations Center Project Reference Database (PRD)

nresets_between_ints.title: Number of resets between integrations
nresets_between_ints.description: Number of resets that separate integrations within an exposure
nresets_between_ints.source: Science and Operations Center Project Reference Database (PRD)

zero_frame.title: Zero frame was downlinked separately
zero_frame.description: T if zero frame was read separately. The first frame of an integration may be read out separately, even if that frame is also averaged into the first group of the integration. If there is a zero frame readout, there will be one for each integration. The zero frame will be stored in a data array in a separate fits extension.
zero_frame.calculation: If Group ID = 0 (in sci_img_hdr), then a zero frame readout is identified

data_problem.title: Science telemetry indicated a problem
data_problem.description: T if science telemetry indicated any problems with the data.

sca_num.title: Sensor Chip Assembly number
sca_num.calculation: Lookup PRD detector table using apid.
sca_num.source: Science and Operations Center Project Reference Database (PRD)

datamode.title: post-processing method used in FPAP
datamode.description: Post-processing method used in FPAP (Focal Plane Array Processor); maps to readout pattern. Possible values are 0-86.

frame_divisor.title: Divisor applied to frame-averaged groups
frame_divisor.description: The FRMDIVSR keyword records the value of the frame divisor used on-board when the flight software averages multiple frames (detector readouts) into a single group. The on-board process works by first summing the data from NFRAMES readouts and then dividing by the frame divisor to form an average. The frame divisor value is equal to NFRAMES for most readout patterns, but not always. When they are not equal, the frame-averaged data values end up with a different scaling than the original data values.
frame_divisor.source: Science and Operations Center Project Reference Database (PRD)

drop_frames1.title: Number of frames dropped prior to first integration
drop_frames1.description: Number of frames dropped prior to first integration

drop_frames3.title: Number of frames dropped between integrations
drop_frames3.description: Number of frames frames dropped between integrations
